content:
Trang Bui I am a fourth-year PhD student in Statistics at University of Waterloo. My PhD projects focus on problems of Design and Analysis of Experimens on Networks. My advisors are Professor Stefan Steiner and Professor Nathaniel Stevens.
Research interest: Network-correlated data, Design and analysis of experiments, Explanable AI.
I am also working as a Teaching Assistant at Department of Statistics and Actuarial Sciences and a Consultant for Statistical Consulting and Collaborative Research Unit at University of Waterloo. I completed my undergraduate studies with Double Majors in Mathematical Sciences and Business Manangement at Korean Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST). I love music, art and languages.
